examples: He’d proved his eloquence, if not his electability, in a series of debates with Stephen Douglas when the two were running for the Senate in 1858.
words.defineEn: the ability to deliver a clear and strong message
words.defineVi: khả năng cung cấp một thông điệp rõ ràng và mạnh mẽ

examples: So it was nice to have an eloquent speaker, but there was a racial undercurrent that I think really hurt America, and we are still living with it today.
You know how eloquent and how smart and on target everybody was in that circle.
He was not as eloquent as he was 30 years ago, like most people wouldn't be.
Residents of Leningrad, which today is known as St. Petersburg, always considered themselves to be more eloquent, more polite, than residents of other cities.
Last night on the floor, in defending the Pennsylvania slate of electors, all of the Pennsylvania delegation had a chance to make very eloquent arguments.
words.defineEn: able to utilize language to convey something well, especially in a persuasive manner
words.defineVi: có thể sử dụng ngôn ngữ để truyền đạt một cái gì đó tốt, đặc biệt là trong một cách thuyết phục

examples: So as Hank Green of Vlogbrothers so eloquently put it: don't forget to vote, America!

The most visible manifestation of it was the issue of woman’s suffrage, raised most eloquently at the Seneca Falls Convention of 1848 where Elizabeth Cady Stanton, Lucretia Mott, Susan B. Anthony and many others wrote and published the Declaration of Sentiments, modeled very closely on the Declaration of Independence.
Like, Sojourner Truth, probably the most famous black woman abolitionist, spoke eloquently of the plight of working class women, especially slaves, since she’d been one until 1827.
I did hear a dog bark, while you were speaking, so eloquently in the background.
And the bad news is the number of people, including children, as Henrietta can so eloquently state.
words.defineEn: in a way that utilizes language to send a strong and clear message, especially when one is speaking in public
words.defineVi: theo cách sử dụng ngôn ngữ để gửi một thông điệp mạnh mẽ và rõ ràng, đặc biệt là khi một người đang nói trước đám đông

examples: To be held in high esteem.
In order to build your self-esteem, set yourself targets you can reach.
I've got low self esteem.

And repetitively leaving things undone chips away at your motivation and self esteem.
words.defineEn: the level of respect and admiration that one has for someone or something
words.defineVi: mức độ tôn trọng và ngưỡng mộ mà một người dành cho ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: To be held in high esteem.
In order to build your self-esteem, set yourself targets you can reach.
I've got low self esteem.
Self-hatred, self-loathing, low self esteem, no self confidence.
And repetitively leaving things undone chips away at your motivation and self esteem.

words.defineVi: để rất ngưỡng mộ hoặc tôn trọng một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó

examples: Every person has the right to express their opinions and beliefs.

He wanted to express his appreciation for all they had done, but words failed him.
Women should feel free to speak their minds and express themselves.
It is important to create a supportive environment where children can express their thoughts and emotions freely.
words.defineEn: to show or make a thought, feeling, etc. known by looks, words, or actions
words.defineVi: để hiển thị hoặc làm cho một suy nghĩ, cảm giác, vv được biết đến bằng vẻ ngoài, lời nói hoặc hành động

examples: She could see from his expression that he caught her drift immediately.

examples: He claimed that the company was not given a fair hearing in the press.

Before making up your mind, you need to give both sides a fair hearing.
I'm sure the legislation got a fair hearing - I'm just surprised it didn't pass.
words.defineEn: the act of giving both sides of an argument a fair chance to express their opinions about something
words.defineVi: hành động cho cả hai bên của một cuộc tranh luận một cơ hội công bằng để bày tỏ ý kiến của họ về một cái gì đó

examples: Cuomo's favorability rating dipped down to 40% in April of 2021, but there was another scandal emerging.

words.defineEn: the degree to which someone or something is accepted or considered appealing

examples: Once providers have bent the rules and had a favorable outcome and response from peers and supervisors, they are likely to be tempted to do it again.

examples: At the same time, media critics are saying that you have written favorably about Facebook and about the project in your New York Times column.

examples: The feeling of sickness soon passed.

words.defineEn: a belief or opinion that is inspired by one's emotions rather than facts
words.defineVi: một niềm tin hoặc ý kiến được lấy cảm hứng từ cảm xúc của một người hơn là sự thật

examples: Find a hobby.
After all, love will find a way.

words.defineVi: để có một ý kiến cụ thể hoặc cảm giác về một cái gì đó mà làm cho một người coi nó theo một cách cụ thể

examples: And I gag from time to time.
